newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan Aug leading index 33.3, coincident 30.0 -- EPA.
newsitem.headline: Japan Aug leading index 33.3, coincident 30.0 -- EPA.

text.p: Japan's diffusion index of leading economic indicators stood at 33.3 on a scale of 100 in August, falling below the so-called "boom or bust" 50 mark for the first time in five months, the Economic Planning Agency said.
A breakdown of the indices of economic indicators follows:
A figure below the "boom or bust" 50 mark suggests the economy will contract in the coming months.
The EPA said in a statement that the indicators showed that the economy was continuing to recover gradually.
A figure for the leading index above 50 is generally taken as suggesting the economy will expand in the coming months.
The coincident index measures current economic conditions, while the lagging index traces economic trends in the past few months.
The index of coincident indicators fell below 50 for the first time in three months. Both indices of leading and coincident indicators were exactly in line with economists' forecasts.
